intro: Nissolia stipitata, commonly known as the slender-stemmed nissolia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are clustered in small inflorescences. Nissolia stipitata is often found in shaded, humid environments such as tropical forests.
